title: Cuisson des Haricots Rouges (Caribbean Red Beans)

instructions.instruction_text: Soak the red beans in cold water overnight (at least 12 hours) to soften them and reduce cooking time.
Drain the soaking water completely and rinse the beans.
Heat the olive oil in a pressure cooker over medium heat.
Add the chopped cive (green onion), bay leaves, and thyme branches. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Add the drained red beans and pour in 2 liters of water.
Add the garlic cloves (whole or crushed) and the four-spice mix (quatre épices). Stir to combine.
Close the pressure cooker lid securely and cook for 45 minutes from the moment the valve starts whistling.
Carefully open the pressure cooker following manufacturer's instructions. Crush the garlic cloves with a fork, add the salt and chopped parsley, and stir well.
Let the beans rest for 15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. Serve hot as a side dish or main course.
